questions.question_text: Which of the following time periods can be selected when viewing Trends in UiPath Communications Mining?

DRAG DROP -
How do you load a taxonomy from a given non-default location text file into a variable?
Instructions: Drag the steps found on the "Left" and drop them on the "Right" in the correct order.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answer is correct
1.Create Variables
2.Assign File Path
3. Read Text File
4.Deserialize JSON

Selected Answer: C
The objective of the Explore phase is to provide each of the labels that are important to you with enough varied and consistent training examples, so that the platform has sufficient training data from which to make accurate predictions across the entire dataset.

https://docs.uipath.com/communications-mining/automation-cloud/latest/user-guide/explore

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the "Explore" phase in UiPath Communications Mining?

choices.C: To provide each label/entity in a taxonomy with enough training examples so the model can make accurate predictions at scale.
choices.D: To review the clusters of similar communications from a dataset that unsupervised learning automatically found.
choices.B: To use the bulk label functionality, a helpful tool to quickly train the model when searching for specific terms.
choices.A: To fully review and correctly tag the model version, regardless if it's "Live" or "Staging".
If it does not have any pipeline data.
choices.C: If it does not have any deployed packages.
choices.D: If it does not have any scheduled pipelines.
choices.B: If it does not have any running pipelines.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A project can only be deleted if it does not have a package currently deployed in a skill. Deleting a project removes all its running and scheduled pipelines, package versions, and pipeline data.

https://docs.uipath.com/ai-center/automation-suite/2023.10/user-guide/managing-projects

questions.question_text: Under what condition can a project be deleted in UiPath AI Center?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Entities are additional elements of structured data which can be extracted from within the messages. Entities include data such as monetary quantities, dates, currency codes, organisations, people, email addresses, URLs, as well as many other industry specific categories.

questions.question_text: What do entities represent in UiPath Communications Mining?
